edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.localnameserver.nodeconfig

Class LNSNodeConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.gnsserver.localnameserver.nodeconfig.LNSNodeConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GNSInterfaceNodeConfig<InetSocketAddress>, Shutdownable, edu.umass.cs.nio.interfaces.NodeConfig<InetSocketAddress>, edu.umass.cs.nio.interfaces.Stringifiable<InetSocketAddress>, edu.umass.cs.reconfiguration.interfaces.ReconfigurableNodeConfig<InetSocketAddress>

    public class LNSNodeConfig
extends Object
implements edu.umass.cs.nio.interfaces.NodeConfig<InetSocketAddress>, GNSInterfaceNodeConfig<InetSocketAddress>, Shutdownable
    This class maintains information that allows the LNS to communicate with Active Replicas and Reconfigurators. It parses a hosts file to gather information about each name server in the system. Also has support for checking to see if the hosts file changes. When that happens the host info is reloaded and the ConsistentHashing.reInitialize method is called. Also contains an implementation of the Stringifiable interface which allows strings to be converted back to NodeIDTypes. The current implementation maintains three NodeIds for each node that is read from the hosts file. A "top-level" id which is identical to the id read from the file, plus to additional ids. One for the activeReplica and one for the reconfigurator. See LNSNodeInfo, addHostInfo and readHostsFile for the details on how those are generated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LNSNodeConfig

        public LNSNodeConfig()
        arun: LNS doesn't need either of active replica IDs or all of their IPs. LNSAsyncClient obviates all such information. LNS only needs to know of reconfigurator addresses, or minimally, at least one alive reconfigurator address.
